result.execSummary:
The defendant Lontrell L Valore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample & imposed the mandatory surcharge.  
Court ordered defendant to pay DNA surcharge and all other applicable costs , surcharges & assessments;   to be collected by the DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to Extended Supervision, but remain a condition of Extended Supervision.

Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the MCSD.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  
Vocational/ educational training.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon, he may not possess any firearms/ body armor and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

NO CONTACT with SAP (DOB 12-16-1998), Lavitrice V.  
As a sex offender, defendant can never have employment/ volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.  
Defendant cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.

Cognitive Behavior therapy.
Court ordered defendant to register as a sex offender.

AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY;  random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: per remittitur dated April 4, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP001862 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Marcella De Peters is relieved from further representing Lontrell L. Valore in this appeal.  See Wis. Stat. rule 809.32 (3).

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lontrell L Valore in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lontrell L Valore in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Lavitrice V.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 29 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 136 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 19 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  
Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*Absolute Sobriety.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*No contact with SAP (DOB 12/16/98), Lavitrice V.
*Pay all costs and surcharges
Court ordered defendant to register as a Sex Offender and can never have employment/volunteer where he/she will supervise or work with children.
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay a DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

Defendant Lontrell L Valore in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lontrell L Valore in custody.  Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 10.
As to count 1 of the Information:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Defendant advised he must register as a sex offender and may be subject to Chapter 980 filings.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
As to counts 2 and 3 the court orders them dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Parties waive PSI.  Court remands defendant and adjourns sentencing to 7-2-2015 at 8:30am Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Notice of Expert Testimony.
jad

Defendant Lontrell L Valore in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lontrell L Valore in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed; COURT ORDER Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges and Milwaukee County Jail recorded telephone conversations.

Defendant Lontrell L Valore in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lontrell L Valore in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of the Initial Appearance of the defendant in this case on February 20, 2015 and defendant did sign a NO CONTACT ORDER.  Sworn for the state:Sarah Blomme-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Arraignment scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SAP (12/16/98).

Defendant Lontrell L Valore in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Lontrell L Valore in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
